rooms.Name: Inside the fissure
rooms.Description:
As you climb down into the fissure, it gets darker and darker until you can
no longer see the light from above you.  It is now completely dark.  You are
still able to feel the fissure walls, and make your way down slowly.  You
feel a strange tingling pass through your body, and feel a little
disoriented.  Looking down you think you might be able to see a little light
far beneath you, but it might just be your imagination.

rooms.Name: A huge fissure
rooms.Description:
The ground has opened up here in a chasm big enough to have swallowed several
ancient trees.  Earth and plantlife has been thrown in all directions,
evidently due to the great force that caused the fissure in the first place.
Rocks and boulders protrude from the edges of the crack, and you think you
might even be able to climb down on them.  You try to see what is below you,
but you can't tell.. it is too dark.  There's only one way to find out...

rooms.Name: A small clearing next to the road
rooms.Description:
The trees recede from the road slightly here, leaving a grassy knoll here
that looks just perfect for a picnic.  As you step onto the spongy grass and
get ready to flop down to the ground, you notice that off to the north there
is a strange crack in the ground.  It looks to be very large and very deep.
Maybe you should go check it out.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Psionicists
rooms.Description:
This room is empty except for a few abstract paintings and sculptures.
There are several objects laying on a table in the corner of the room, a
torch, a small weight, and a solid stone block.  This is where the master
psionicists instructs his pupils on the rudiments of psionic powers.  In
order to become one of the mental elite, you must be able to lift the weight,
light the torch and detonate the block, all with only the power of your mind.
Mental discipline is the mantra of the psionicist, and you must learn this
before you may become one of them.  Though a reclusive lot, psionicists are
social among their own, and if you pass the tests you will be admitted as if
you were always one of them.

rooms.Name: The Reading Room
rooms.Description:
A large, rather plainly decorated stone room is almost bare, save for the
books in their cases.  Here and there across the expanse of granite slabs
which make up the floor, rather plain wooden desks and benches stand. It is
very peaceful and quiet here when you contrast it to the bustle and noise of
the congested traffic in the busy temple that lies just to the east.

Exits.Description: The temple of Midgaard is here.

rooms.Name: Dressing Room
rooms.Description:
This is a room to let you take care of all your equipment-moving
before you venture out into the mud, where you might spam people.
Since you enter the game wearing the equipment the same way as
when you last quit, you should be all set, though :)

Those of you that are new to Ashes to Ashes, you can get a good
start on leveling and equipment by going through the zone found
down, north, north, east, from this room.

Those of you new to mudding in general can find information and
experience in the zone down twice from here.

Enjoy your stay at Ashes to Ashes. Keep in mind that once you leave
this room you cannot enter it again, unless you quit the game or die.

rooms.Name: Cleric's Inner Sanctum
rooms.Description:
In the darkness of the inner santum, incense hangs heavily on the
air burning in bowls on the altar wich stands against the west wall.
A large statue stands upon the altar, the representation of Khel'daar,
the god of the healing arts.  He looks down upon you with an almost
smug expression, arms spread wide in blessing.  At the foot of the
altar, sacrifices of food, armor, weapons, jewels, gold and other
valuables have been left by those who would cultivate his favor.

rooms.Name: Cleric's Bar
rooms.Description:
A quiet and refined atmosphere prevails in the Cleric's bar.  The room is
panelled in a dark, reddish colored wood which has been polished to a dull
shine.  The stone floor is mostly covered by a fine, burgundy oriental 
carpet woven with a floral design in gold.  Comfortably padded chairs
are here and there about the room arranged near small tables. A large,
stone fireplace stands upon one wall, flames flickering brightly inside.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the waiter:

   Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the waiter.
   List - The waiter will show you all the different drinks and
          specialties, and tell the price of each.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Cleric's Guild
rooms.Description:
The entrance hall is built of a fine grey stone blocks which have been 
polished till they gleam.  The paving stones are slate gray and are a
bit rough under foot.  An arched door stands open to the north, a holy
symbol carved into the keystone.  To the east, the bustle and noise of
the temple square rings loudly, along with the sound of trickling water.

rooms.Name: The Temple Square
rooms.Description:
In the temple square, huge marble steps lead up the the massive temple gate
which stands to the north.  The stone has been polished by loving hands and
gleams faintly when the light hits it, showing little sign of wear.  A large
stone archway to the east leads into the Cleric's Guild.  To the west, a
well-established inn stands, constructed of stone and wooden beams.  A sigm
of painted wood swings back and forth over its doorway, upon it is carved an
enormous and formidable looking boar with great curved tusks and yellow eyes.

Exits.Description: The Grunting Boar in is here.
The entrance to the Cleric's Guild is here.

rooms.Name: Entrance Hall of the Grunting Boar Inn
rooms.Description:
Inside the entrance of the Grunting Boar Inn, the hallway is neat and clean
with simple and functional furniture.  Upon the dark flagstones of the floor
stand wide wooden benches, backed up against the walls.  A few drops of wax
have dripped down upon the floor from a large metal chandalier that hangs near
the peak of the ceiling.  The Post Office is to the north.  A sturdy wooden
staircase leads up to the reception and a busy bar is to the east.

rooms.Name: The Grunting Boar
rooms.Description:
The bar room is wide and spacious and its flagstone floor has been recently 
swept clean and covered with sweet-smelling rushes.  Long trestle tables with
wooden benches are here and there about the room, arranged in a fashion to 
take most advantage of the heat from the large fireplace on the north wall.
Oo the east side of the room, a large bar stands, crafted from a fine, dark
wood. All over its top are various carvings and symbols which draw the eye.
Lanterns flicker softly and add to a comfortable and peaceful feeling here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:
Free instructions provided by the Grunting Boar Inn.

   Buy  - Buy something (drinkable) from the bartender.
   List - The bartender will show you all the different drinks and
          specialties, and tell the price of each.

Although it is very hard to understand, you think it looks a lot like beer,
poems about beer, and small beer-mugs.

rooms.Name: The Reception
rooms.Description:
In the comfortable reception area, a wide wooden staircase leads down to the
entrance hall below.  A large emerald-green rug covers the center area of 
the polished wooden floor.  A wooden desk with a large book upon it stands
near the east wall.  To the north, is the Cryogenic Center and to the south,
the reimbursement file update room sends shivers down your spine.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Rooms are expensive but good!  You may:

   Offer - get an offer on a room - Time is in real life days.
   Rent  - Rent a room (saves your stuff, and quits the game),
           minimum charge is one day.


                          MY WAY OR THE HIGHWAY
                             PAY YOUR RENT!
                WE WON'T THINK TWICE BEFORE KICKING YOU OUT.

rooms.Name: The Bakery
rooms.Description:
The sweet scents of fresh danish and baking breads fill the bakery pleasantly.
The baked goods are arranged appealingly in spotlessly clean glass cases.  The
wide wooden planks of the floor have been recently swept and white-washed walls
show signs that someone has taken great care to keep them clean.  The windows
on either side of the door to the south are curtained and have wooden benches
set beneath them.  Through them, you can see the traffic on the street outside.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Free instructions provided by the store:

   Buy  - Will buy you some bread or pastry.
   List - The baker will kindly tell you the price and sort of the bread in
          his bakery.

You see that this is truly delicious pastry.  Must be made by a Dane from
Denmark (which surely is not the capital of Sweden!).  Former ruler of
Scandinavia, England, Northern Germany, Northern France, Russia, Greenland,
Iceland, Estonia etc.  etc.
   The sight of those large, wholesome chokoladeboller makes your mouth water
and your soul sing.

rooms.Name: The General Store
rooms.Description:
Inside the general store, the shelves and cases are piled high with a variety
of useful merchandise.  Everything is clean and well organized and the freshly
white-washed walls fairly shine.  A globe hovers near the ceiling, shedding a
warm light over the room.  The wide wooden boards of the floor are coverd by a
handmade rug and the dark wooden counter has been polished until it fairly
gleams. A large sign stands prominently upon the counter.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

rooms.Name: The Weapon Shop
rooms.Description:
Inside the weapon shop, armaments are hung upon the walls on heavy pegs, some
gleaming with polish and others are neglected looking.  Some finer pieces of
craftsmanship are displayed in glass cases which are set about the room. The
sounds of metal being hammered come from a closed door to the back of the room.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

rooms.Name: Main Street
rooms.Description:
You are at the end of the main street of Midgaard.  South of here is the
entrance to Uncle Juan's Eatery.  The street continues east towards the
market square.  Ye Olde Water Shoppe is to the north and to the west is
the city gate.

rooms.Name: Main Street
rooms.Description:
You are on the main street passing through the City of Midgaard.  South of
here is the general store, and the bakery is to the north. East of here is
the market square.

rooms.Name: Market Square
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the market square, the famous Square of Midgaard.
A large, peculiar looking statue is standing in the middle of the square.
Roads lead in every direction, north to the temple square, south to Odin
Square, east and westbound is the main street.

ExtraDescs.Description: What you see is the Midgaard Worm, stretching around the Palace of Midgaard.

rooms.Name: The Main Street
rooms.Description:
You are on the main street crossing through town.  To the north is the
armory, and the main street continues east.  To the west you see and
hear the market place, to the south is a small smithy's shop.

rooms.Name: The Main Street
rooms.Description:
The main street, to the north is the weapon shop and to the south is the
Guild of Swordsmen.  To the east you leave town and to the west the street
leads to the market square.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Mage's Guild
rooms.Description: The entrance hall is a small, poor lighted room.

rooms.Name: Mage's Bar
rooms.Description:
The bar is one of the weirdest in the land.  Mystical images float around
the air.  Illusions of fine furniture appear all around the room.

rooms.Name: Mage's Laboratory
rooms.Description:
This is the Magical Experiments Laboratory.  Dark smoke-stained stones
arch over numerous huge oaken tables, most of these cluttered with strange-
looking pipes and flasks.  The floor is covered with half-erased pentagrams
and even weirder symbols, and a blackboard in a dark corner has only been
partially cleaned, some painful-looking letters faintly visible.  A well in
the middle of the floor leads down into darkness.  Vile smells waft from the
depths.

rooms.Name: The Armory
rooms.Description:
The armory with all kinds of armors on the walls and in the window.  You
see helmets, shields and chain mails.  To the south is the main street.
On the wall is a small note.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You can use these commands for trading:

  value <item>     To get the price of an item in your possession.
  sell <item>      To sell something.
  buy <item>       To buy something (provided that the shop has it in store).
  list             Gives you a listing of the shop's inventory.

        WE DON'T GIVE CREDIT; WE DON'T EXPECT TO RECEIVE CREDIT!
                             NO HAGGLING

rooms.Name: Entrance Hall to the Guild of Swordsmen
rooms.Description:
The entrance hall to the Guild of Swordsmen.  A place where one has to be
careful not to say something wrong (or right).  To the east is the bar and to
the north is the main street.

rooms.Name: The Bar of Swordsmen
rooms.Description:
The bar of swordsmen, once upon a time beautifully furnished.  But now the
furniture is all around you in small pieces.  To the south is the yard, and
to the west is the entrance hall.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance hall to the thieves guild.

rooms.Name: The Tournament and Practice Yard
rooms.Description:
The practice yard of the fighters.  To the north is the bar.  A well leads
down into darkness.

rooms.Name: Eastern End of Poor Alley
rooms.Description:
You are at the poor alley.  South of here is the Grubby Inn and to the
east you see common square.  The alley continues further west.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance to the Paladins Guild.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sparkling circle seems to be some sort of rift. Trough it you see a 
swirling haze, occasionally parting to reveal a strange and alien landscape 
under a hostile grey sky.  The loud crackling noise that the circle's spark
cause convinces you that trying to squeeze through it could be perilous.

rooms.Name: The Common Square
rooms.Description:
The common square, people pass you, talking to each other.  To the west is
the poor alley and to the east is the dark alley.  To the north, this square
is connected to the market square.  From the south you notice a nasty smell.

rooms.Name: The Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
The dark alley, to the west is the common square and to the south is the
Guild of Thieves.  The alley continues east.

ExtraDescs.Description: It is the thieves guild, don't enter if you care about your health or money.

rooms.Name: Entrance Hall to the Guild of Thieves
rooms.Description:
The entrance hall to the thieves' and assassins' guild.  A place where you
can lose both your life and your money, if you are not careful.  To the north
is the dark alley and to the east is the thieves' bar.

rooms.Name: The Thieves Bar
rooms.Description:
The bar of the thieves.  Once upon a time this place was beautifully
furnished, but now it seems almost empty.  To the south is the yard, and to
the west is the entrance hall.
   (Maybe the furniture has been stolen?!)

ExtraDescs.Description: As you look at the furniture, the chair you sit on disappears.

rooms.Name: The Secret Yard
rooms.Description:
The secret practice yard of thieves and assassins.  To the north is the
bar.  A well leads down into darkness.

rooms.Name: The Dump
rooms.Description:
This is the city dump, where the civic-minded citizens of Midgaard go to
dump their refuse. At the bottom of the heap of trash, you see a softly
glowing light shining through a hole that may be large enough for you to
climb down. To the southwest, you see a small path. North of you is the
Common Square, stomping grounds of all sorts of low-lifes.

Exits.Description: A softly glowing light beckons you downward...

rooms.Name: The Pet Shop
rooms.Description:
The Pet Shop is a small crowded store, full of cages and animals of
various sizes.  There is a sign on the wall.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The sign reads:

  Use 'List' to see the available pets.
  Use 'Buy <pet>' to buy yourself a pet.

  Instructions for having pets:

  You can use 'order <pet> <instructions>' to order your pets around.
  If you abuse your pet, it will no longer regard you as its master.
  If you have several pets you may use 'order followers <instructions>'

  You can name the pet you buy as : "buy <pet> <name>"

 Regards,
.
 The Shopkeeper

rooms.Name: Pet Shop Store
rooms.Description:
This  is the small dark room in which the Pet shop keeps his pets.
It is vital that this room's virtual number is exactly one larger
than the Pet Shop number.

rooms.Name: The Magic Shop
rooms.Description:
Behind the counter you see various items, neatly placed in racks,
presumably most of them are magic.

rooms.Name: The Bitch and Moan room for the Morts and Immorts.
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the infamous Bitch and Whine room for all those
disgruntled players and immortals.  Every wall is covered with really
sick artwork and colorful phrases about the people on this site.  You
could literally take years trying to read all of the notes that people
have left over the years, but you will have to satisfy yourself with
reading the most current posts (seeing as we hope to have fixed most of
the old prooblems).  Have fun and file a complaint to end your day of
murder and mayhem.

rooms.Name: Notice Room
rooms.Description:
This is a room in which we have a board that we post notices on coding
changes, or other useful information.  You are required to know the info
that is on this board.  There will sometimes be rules changes posted here
too. Saying that you did not see the rules change on this board is NOT a
valid excuse.  It is your job to check this board, and know the rules.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Elders
rooms.Description:
This shrine is dedicated to the elders of the various classes,
those whose deeds are legendary, and whose skills are unmatched.
The elders who still live, and wait to take their places among
the honored dead may be prevailed upon to teach their art to the
uninitiated. You have but to seek out the master of the class
you wish to become, and train with him.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Monks
rooms.Description:
This sparsely decorated room seems to encourage meditation and
contemplation, for such is the way of the monk. If you chose to
train with their master, you will learn to control you mind and
body, being able to accomplish feats of unarmed combat that many
would be hard pressed to match even with weapons and armor. But
you will learn discipline as well. You will learn the ways of stealth
and of self control, as well as those of combat.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Warriors
rooms.Description:
A tribute to the art of warfare over the centuries, this is the
kind of place a warrior can be proud to retire to. Well-used
weapons rest in racks, some still chipped of bloodied, reminders
to the great services they provided to their wielders. If you
choose the path of the warrior, such glories may be yours as well.
But do not delude yourself, for the reputations of legendary
warriors are built upon the deaths of those warriors less worthy
than themselves. If you decide to become a warrior, may glory be
yours!

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Clerics
rooms.Description:
You gape in awe of this most holy of places. You feel as if the
gods themselves are with you...they may well be. For if you choose
the life of a cleric, you will be a holy emissary. In return for
your service, you will be given the gift of healing, and the power
to protect yourself and others. People will turn to you for aid
in their quests, counting on you for their safety. If you wish to
follow this path of divinity, may the gods smile upon you.

rooms.Name: Inside the West Gate of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  Main Street leads
east and West Wall Road leads south from here.

Exits.Description: The city gate is to the west.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  Main Street leads
west from here.  To the south a narrow road follows the city wall.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

rooms.Name: West Wall Road
rooms.Description:
You are walking next to the western city wall.  The road continues further
south and the city gate is just north of here.  To the east is Carnival
Lane, and even from here you can see and hear strang things.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: West Wall Road
rooms.Description:
You are walking next to the western city wall.  West Wall Road continues
further north and south.  A small, poor alley leads east.
Some letters have been written on the wall here.

ExtraDescs.Description: It says 'Who watches the watchmen?'

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Poor Alley
rooms.Description:
You are in the poor alley, which continues further east.  You see the
city wall to the west, and you hear clinking, clanking, and clattering
noises from a mysterious building to the south.

Exits.Description: A mysterious building lies to the south.

rooms.Name: Alley at Levee
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the alley which continues east and west.  South of
here you see the levee.

rooms.Name: Eastern end of Alley
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the eastern end of the alley.  The city wall is to
your east, and curves around blocking you way south as well.  Once a
building stood to the north, but it has collapsed and been trampled over,
creating a path to East Wall Road.  At your feet is an entrance to the
city's sewer system is just below you.

Exits.Description: A manhole leads down to the smelly Midgaard Sewer System.

rooms.Name: West Wall Road
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the road next to the western city wall, which
continues north.  South of here is a bridge across the river.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Grubby Inn
rooms.Description:
You are inside the old Grubby Inn.  This place has not been cleaned for
several decades; vile smells make you dizzy.

rooms.Name: Levee
rooms.Description:
You are at the levee.  South of here you see the river gently flowing west.
The river bank is very low making it possible to enter the river.

rooms.Name: Warehouse
rooms.Description:
You are inside the warehouse.  The room is decorated with various old
items from ships.

rooms.Name: On the Bridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on the stone bridge crosses the river.  The bridge is
built out from the western city wall and the river flows west through an
opening in the wall ten feet below the bridge.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.
You cannot really see it from here as it is somewhere beneath your feet.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar, just like the wall.

rooms.Name: Outside the West Gate of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the west you
can see the edge of a big forest.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: Outside the East Gate of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are by two small towers that have been built into the city wall and
connected with a footbridge across the heavy wooden gate.  To the east the
plains stretch out in the distance.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is too high up to reach but it looks as if one easily could walk across it
from one tower to the other.

It is a set of very big double doors made from hard wood.  They have been
reinforced with large iron bands to make them even more sturdy.  One of the
doors is equipped with a very big lock.

Both of the towers are built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to
each other with some kind of mortar, just like the city wall.

It is built from large grey rocks that have been fastened to each other with
some kind of mortar.  It is far too high to climb.

rooms.Name: By the Temple Altar
rooms.Description:
You are by the temple altar in the northern end of the Temple of Midgaard.
A huge altar made from white polished marble is standing in front of you and
behind it is a ten foot tall sitting statue of Odin, the King of the Gods.
To the north, steps lead out the back of the temple towards the countryside.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The statue represents the one-eyed Odin sitting on a his throne.  He has
long, grey hair and beard and a strict look on his face.  On top of the
throne, just above his shoulders, his two ravens Hugin and Munin are sitting
and at his feet are his wolves Gere and Freke.

Even though the altar is more than ten feet long it appears to be made from a
single block of white virgin marble.

rooms.Name: Shop of The Gods
rooms.Description:
This room is a perfect circle made completely of wood. It is seven feet
tall, and ten feet in diameter. It is dimly lit with golden light from an
unseen source. A simple yellow curtain closes off the entry to the street
to the south. There is a sign near the curtain, but besides that, the room
is featureless.
A sign demands your attention!

ExtraDescs.Description:
This is where you buy quest items with your quest points.

To see the items for sale and their cost, type "LIST".
You can view only part of the list with "LIST PROTECTION", "LIST HITTER",
and "LIST MANA".

BEFORE YOU BUY AN ITEM be sure to check out its stats. To view the
stats on an item, type "IDENTIFY ##", where ## is the number of the
item as shown in "LIST".
ITEMS ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT ANY TIME. Always identify an item before
you buy it. This will also let you know that you have the right number
so you don't accidentally buy the wrong thing.

To buy an item, type "BUY ##", where ## is the number of the item as shown
in "LIST". This will buy the item, so be sure it's what you want.
THERE ARE NO REFUNDS, ALL SALES ARE FINAL.

To sell an item, type "SELL NAME", where NAME is the name of an item you
have in inventory. You can only sell quest items, and you will only
get back HALF THE POINTS YOU PAID FOR IT, EVEN IF THE PRICE HAS CHANGED.

rooms.Name: Uncle Juan's Eatery
rooms.Description:
This place makes your nose run just from the smell of the spicy food they
sell.  Spicy as it may be it still looks very tasty.  A box of taco shells
is set on the counter.
   There is a large, friendly sign hanging on the wall here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It is a hand-written sign with large, friendly letters which say "If it
ain't Uncle Juan's, it ain't any good!"

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Paladin's Guild
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the entranceway to the Paladin's Guild.  It is a large
stone archway, beneath which a large, stonyfaced guard stands.

Exits.Description: You see the eastern end of Poor Alley.

rooms.Name: Ye Olde Water Shoppe
rooms.Description:
You are in Wally's World O' Water, whose proprietor, Wally, is sure to
have something to meet all of your water needs.

rooms.Name: Behind the Temple Altar
rooms.Description:
You are on a dirt path leading away from the Temple Altar which is south
of here.  To the north, the path continues through the lush contryside of
Midgaard.

rooms.Name: Midgaard north-south highway
rooms.Description:
You are walking along a newly paved highway.  To the east lies a pleasant
prairie with a small ridge.  There are bunnies and chipmunks all happily
and playfully bouncing too and fro.  To the north and distant west you can see
the pillars of Rome.

Exits.Description: You see more of the path through the Great Field.
You spot a small path that leads off into the woods.
You see the path which goes back to Midgaard.

rooms.Name: Midgaard north-south highway
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the middle of the north south highway, to the north
Clay road which will take you into the heart of Rome.  To the distant
east you see a dark castle, you think you might just go to Rome and
visit your relatives in the Noble house.

Exits.Description: You see a small clay path.
You see more of the Field.

rooms.Name: The Post Office
rooms.Description:
You are in the central post office for Midgaard.  Piles of assorted mail lay
untouched in the corners, collecting cobwebs.  Several large crates have been
pried open by curious customs agents, and are now stacked along the west wall,
hiding plenty of 'WANTED' posters.
   There is a sign posted on the wall here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Faces of various known Killers and Thieves can barely be seen behind the crates
on the west wall.  Some of them look quite familar, sorta like that guy who you
saw in the Reception a minute ago...but then again, they are rather hard to see
past the crates.

As you know, it is illegal to send contraband items through the Midgaard mail.
The custom's agents use this as a great excuse to seize liquor, rare spices,
and just about anything they might find useful or profitable.
They seem to cover everything here, even the Postmaster himself.

**********************************************************
*     							 *
*    Mail Instructions :                                 *
*							 *
*      To send a note to someone : 			 *
*         MAIL <playername>				 *
*     							 *
*      To see if you have any mail :			 *
*         CHECK						 *
*							 *
*      To get the Postmaster to give you your mail :     *
*         RECEIVE					 *
*							 *
*         Stamps cost 350 coins per letter               *
*         Type 'HELP MAIL' for more info                 *
**********************************************************

rooms.Name: Midgaard Donation Room
rooms.Description:
You are in a small, undecorated room just off of the main temple.  There
are a couple of small wooden benches here where people occasionally sit
while they wait for items to appear.  The temple is to the west.

rooms.Name: The Cryogenic Center
rooms.Description:
You are standing in an impossible white sterile room with cylindrical
body-length canisters lined up against the walls.  The Reception is to the
south.

rooms.Name: The Paladin's Bar
rooms.Description:
This is where the Paladins come to relax for a drink or two and unwind.  The
bar is well stocked, the people are friendly, but don't mess with the waiter.

Exits.Description: You see the Paladins Inner Sanctum.
You see the entrance to the Paladins Guild.

rooms.Name: The Paladin's Inner Sanctum
rooms.Description:
You are in a small well-lit room, with very few furnishings.  The walls are
adorned with ornate paintings, and a huge holy shield with a huge cross
engraved on it takes up the best part of one whole wall.

rooms.Name: The statistics shop
rooms.Description:
You are standing a most unusual shop.  Numbers swirl through the air
forming a thin mist.  A long counter cluttered with bizarre items of
immense magic stands before you.  Behind the counter is a thin and pale
man. You sense that even though he does look very tough, it would be a
VERY bad idea to get into a fight with him.  On the wall is a large sign.
READ THE SIGN BEFORE YOU DO ANYTHING HERE!

ExtraDescs.Description:
Buying stats uses practices. Type list to see what you can
buy and how many practices it will take.
Buying stats will not change how many practices it takes to
multiclass, so if you wish to do so, find out how many you
need before you buy stats.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Anti-Paladin Guild
rooms.Description:
You stand before the entrance to the Anti-Paladin Guild.  Evil
radiates from this room sending a chill down your spine.  A tight
lipped guard stands watch over the entrance.

rooms.Name: Anti-Paladin Bar
rooms.Description:
A dreary looking place where the Anti-Paladin's take a break from
causing destruction upon the mortal world.  The bar looks well stocked,
but the waiter seems like he will be happy to kill you if you give him
a reason.

Exits.Description: The Entrance of the Anti-Paladin Guild

rooms.Name: The Anti-Paladins Domain
rooms.Description:
Evil strikes you a physical blow upon entering this room.  A fallen
cross covered in blood lies against the one wall.  This whole room
is blood stained and radiates pure evil.

rooms.Name: A paved road
rooms.Description:
You are on a paved road leading east and west. A street diverges from the
road, leading south. You catch the whiff of dead bodies from that direction.
The gates of the fair city of Midgaard lie to the west.

rooms.Name: Temple of Midgaard
rooms.Description:
You are in the southern end of the temple hall in the Temple of Midgaard.
The temple has been constructed from giant marble blocks, eternal in
appearance, and most of the walls are covered by ancient wall paintings
picturing Gods, Giants and peasants.
   Large steps lead down through the grand temple gate, descending the huge
mound upon which the temple is built and ends on the temple square below.
To the west, you see the Reading Room.  The donation room is in a small
alcove to your east.

Exits.Description: At the northern end of the temple hall is a statue and a huge altar.

In the east, you see a small alcove with a rickety wooden sign which
reads "Midgaard Donation Room."
You look down the huge stone steps at the temple square below.

rooms.Name: End of a paved road
rooms.Description:
You are at the end of the paved road.  There are side streets leading
everywhere. The sky is slightly cloudy, and there is a cool breeze coming out
of the west.  There are trees all around you.  As you glance around, the
hairon your back stands up.  You look up and you see a fuzzy portal...as you
put your hands up, you begin to float upwards...you can't stop yourself from
going up.  As you think how you can STOP going up...you begin to float
down...There is a voice...it seems to say something like reading a sign.

Exits.Description: A misty road stretches to the south.

ExtraDescs.Description: This is the portal to the Comic and Cartoon Land.  Enjoy. :)

rooms.Name: A dirt road
rooms.Description:
The pavement has ended and there is a dirt road that leads into a
forest type area.  There seems to be eyes looking at you from every
point.

rooms.Name: A dirt road
rooms.Description:
The pavement has ended and there is a dirt road that leads into a
forest type area.  There seems to be eyes looking at you from every
point.

rooms.Name: A dirt road
rooms.Description:
The pavement has ended and there is a dirt road that leads into a
forest type area.  There seems to be eyes looking at you from every
point.

rooms.Name: A dirt road
rooms.Description:
You see a slope forming along the east...you are going to have to
climb down there...since you here singing...sounds like that song
from Snow White and the 7 DWARVES...but it isnt' a toon song.

rooms.Name: A dirt road, with a slope along the path.
rooms.Description:
As you look east, you realize that the ground has fallen away...there
is a slight footing where you can climb down.

rooms.Name: A pearl gate
rooms.Description:
The dirt road comes to an end here.  There is a pearl gate here and there
is a wall running perpendicular to the road.  The wall is quite high, and
is not climbable.  The gate is open, or can be opened easily.
A sign is embedded in the ground here.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Welcome to the King's Castle!! Come in and set up an appointment with
the Royal Herald to meet with his majesty.
Arthur Welmar III, King of all lands, seas and skies.

rooms.Name: A small dirt path
rooms.Description: A small path leads away from the dirt road

rooms.Name: Odin Square
rooms.Description:
You are standing in luxurious Odin square.  To the north lies the Market
area with shops to sell you what you need.  To the south lies the poorer
parts of town.  You notice many thieves and evil aura'd men head south,
while clerical and battle hardened people head north.  Carnival Lane runs
east and west, home to all manner of strange sights.

rooms.Name: Fantasy Hotel
rooms.Description:
You are in the most magnificent hotel you have ever seen. The lobby is 
filled with a pleasant perfume and a long red fluffy carpet goes across
it towards the front desk.

rooms.Name: the Luxury Room
rooms.Description:
Thick tawny carpetings cushions your steps as you enter the suite. Sunlight
filters through silk frame windows that extend the length of the wall. A low
table of polished mahogany sits before a fireplace. A brocade chaise stands
before one window, it's cream and cocoa silk stripped fabric shimmers in the
light. Raised a series of steps above lays a four poster bed of the same 
mahogany topped with a plush down comforter. Dotted over the bed are cream
and cocoa velvety encased pillows, embedded with stripes interruptions. One
corner of the comforter is turned down invitingly, exposing the sensous silk
sheets of a cafe au lait color

rooms.Name: Carnival Lane
rooms.Description:
This end of Carnival Lane is dominated by the mystics.  Time seems to
move a little slower here and light is a little less bright.  Things that
you cannot find anywhere else in the world are commonplace in the shops
here.  The road continues east and west, and to the north is a shop where
you can have your very being changed.

rooms.Name: Carnival Lane
rooms.Description:
All around you are amazing sights and sounds.  Two wizards wage a mock
battle over the street with illusionary dragons.  Small groups of people
gather around storytellers to hear fantastic tails of knights, maidens,
and all manner of ferocious creature.  Carnival Lane continues to the east
and connects with West Wall Road to the west.  A shop to the north deals
in magic items and you can improve your own magic skills to the south.

rooms.Name: Carnival Lane
rooms.Description:
This end of Carnival Lane is very much like a circus.  Merry music
comes from a small organ on the side of the road.  Animal trainers show
off in the streets.  You can get your own trained pet to the south and to
the north is an unusual magic shop.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: Carnival Lane
rooms.Description:
Clowns, mimes, and jugglers move through the street here entertaining
crowds.  Large, colorful flags hang into the street and give you the
sensation of being in a rainbow.  On the side of the street are peddlers
selling snake oil and miracle cures.  The road continues to the west, and
meets up with East Wall Road to the east. To the south is the House of
Horrors. To the north is a dimly lit room closed off by a curtain.

rooms.Name: East Wall Road
rooms.Description:
This road is hardly more than an alley.  Dogs nose through garbage
looking for something to eat.  Those who pass through here eye you
suspiciously.  To the north is the eastern gate of the city, and to the
west is Carnival Lane.  It spears that there was a building to the south
at one time, but it has collapsed and it's remains trampled down,
connecting this road with an alley.

rooms.Name: House of Horrors
rooms.Description:
Throughout this house are moving floors, strategically placed mirrors,
and shifting walls.  Masked figures are waiting around every corner to
surprise you, jumping out and then disappearing without a trace.  Although
it looks small from the outside, this place seems huge on the inside.  It
would be very easy to get lost.

rooms.Name: A Smithy's Shop
rooms.Description:
It's very warm in here, and a red glow comes from the back of the shop
where a small forge burns.  Soot and grime covers everything, and it
smells repulsive.  Iron working tools lie near an anvil, and leather
working tools hang on the wall above a counter.  Spare materials are piled
throughout the shop.
A sign hangs on the wall.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Welcome to the shop. Here I can repair armor that has been damaged
by corrosion, or acid. This is not an easy task, so it will not be
cheap. To get a price for fixing a piece of armor, type
Appraise <item name>. To have it repaired type Repair <item name>.

Thank you for your business.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Magic-Users
rooms.Description:
You head spins as you encounter the arcane energies that swirl
around this shrine to the wielders of mystical powers. The walls
and floors are adorned with runes and glyphs that you can only
begin to understand. If you truly wish to aquire such esoteric
knowledge, then you should follow the path of the magic-user. To
learn the ways of wizards requires great dedications and study,
but the rewards are powers that most beings can only imagine. If
you are willing to earn the rewards of these intellectual powers,
then apprentice yourself to the master.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Thieves
rooms.Description:
This room is stacked with riches enough to fill your every dream
of wealth. Piles of gold, gems, and artwork line the walls and
cover the floor. You're worldly enough to realize that nobody earned
this booty. This is the work of extraordinary thievery. You know
that there are risks inherent to the stealing of other people's
property, but the rewards are prominantly displayed around you. If
you decide to follow the way of the thief, such riches could be 
yours someday. But beware, if you become a thief, you'll always
have to watch your back, for your colleagues are not above putting
a dagger in somone's back.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Paladins
rooms.Description:
You look to be in some kind of royal art museum. All along the
walls are arrayed shields, bearing the crests of various noble
heroes. Suits of armor stand silent watch in corners of the room,
polished and looking most impressive. If you are one who feels the
need to be heroic and are willing to sacrifice yourself for the
good of others, then perhaps you should become a paladin. The old
order of paladins accepts commoners and nobles alike these days,
so you needn't worry about your social position. Anyone who wishes
to follow the path of honor and nobility may join the ranks of the
paladins.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the AntiPaladins
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a room out of some sort of gothic horror
story. Ornate carvings of gargoyles and other fell beasts seem to
have just a bit too much malice in their lifeless eyes. These
inanimate guardians watch over this site of unholy practices. On
a small table are arrayed a set of nasty-looking weapons, designed
as much to inflict pain as to defeat an adversary in combat. A
shelf of books, bound in leather the color of dried blood details
ceremonies and spells that will give the caster much unholy might.
If your soul means nothing to you, venture forth...read from the
books, and take up these fell weapons. Your reward for taking the
path of the antipaladin will be untold power.

rooms.Name: The Shrine of the Rangers
rooms.Description:
This rustic old place is a retirement home for great hunters.
The walls are decorated with the heads of various mobs from around
the mud, trophies from successful tracking expeditions. Trained in
woodland lore, the ranger may apply his skills as a simple guide,
aiding others who have lost their way, or as a deadly predator,
hunting creatures unaccustomed to being preyed upon. If you want to
learn the ways of the forest, for whichever reason, take up the
way of the ranger.

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Monks' Guild
rooms.Description:
The guild of monks is a solemn place, filled with trainees and
masters who take their abilities very seriously. Showing the
proper respect for the venerable masters would be the wise course
of action.

rooms.Name: The Bar of Monks
rooms.Description:
This is a bar in only the loosest sense of the word. The only
drink served is water, and there are no servants to get it for you.
In fact, the quiet in the room gives it the feeling of a meditation
chamber.

rooms.Name: The Monks' Practice Yard
rooms.Description:
A tribute to the ancient martial arts, every weapon ever known
to the monks line the high walls of the practice yard. By the end
of your training you will be expected to have mastered them all.

rooms.Name: Well of Mystery
rooms.Description:
You feel dizzy when you enter this room. There is power flowing all
around. On the north wall is a structure that looks like a forge, except
there are no coals and no smoke. This is the Well of Mystery. It is filled
with purple light that is almost tangible. In the center of the well is a
small point that looks like a star, but is as bright as the sun. The walls
of the room are made of gray bricks, but they are lit a sickly lavender by
the well. On the east wall is a wooden shelf containing small bags of
powder and strange tools that look magical. To the south is an open
doorway leading to the street. Although the outside world is only a few
steps away, it looks like it is on the other side of a vast purple desert.
